material.translation[0].definitions[0].d: cloth used for making clothes, curtains etc
material.translation[0].definitions[0].e: a cape made of a soft material
material.translation[0].definitions[1].d: a solid substance such as wood, plastic, or metal
material.translation[0].definitions[1].e: a paper company which imports raw materials (=substances which have not been treated) from North America.
Animals depend on plant material for food.
material.translation[0].definitions[2].d: the things that are used for making or doing something
material.translation[0].definitions[2].e: Videos often make good teaching material.
material.translation[0].definitions[3].d: information or ideas used in books, films etc
material.translation[0].definitions[3].e: His act contains a lot of new material.
the raw material (=information that has not been carefully examined) for an article
Anita is collecting material for a novel.
material.translation[0].note_box[0].sect: for making clothes etc
material
cloth used for making clothes, curtains etc
She bought some pretty dress material.
fabric
cloth used for making clothes, curtains etc
Man-made fabrics such as polyester are easy to wash and iron.
furnishing fabrics
woven material, especially material made from natural substances such as cotton and wool, which has not yet been made into any other products
The main trade was the production of woollen cloth.
textiles
a general word for all types of cloth – used especially when talking about the business of producing and selling them
Textiles are one of Mexico’s main exports.
the textile industry
a solid or liquid substance
material
a substance, especially one that can be used for making things
building materials
The island has to import oil and other raw materials  (=materials used for making things).
radioactive material
substance
a type of material such as a chemical or a mineral
The green colour of the leaf is due to a substance called chlorophyll.
Dioxin is one of the most toxic substances known to man.
matter
a type of substance – used especially in the following phrases
waste matter from the body
It is important to add plenty of organic matter to the soil.
People throw away lots of vegetable matter.
stuff
a substance – used especially when you do not know exactly what it is
What’s that sticky stuff on the floor?
material.translation[1].definitions[0].d: relating to your money, possessions, living conditions etc, rather than the needs of your mind or soul
material.translation[1].definitions[0].e: The spiritual life is more important than material possessions.
a society that places high importance on material rewards
material.translation[1].definitions[1].d: relating to the real world and physical objects, rather than religious or spiritual things
material.translation[1].definitions[1].e: According to some, the material world is all that exists.
material.translation[1].definitions[2].d: important and needing to be considered when making a decision
material.translation[1].definitions[3].d: important and having a noticeable effect
material.translation[2].definitions[0].d: something you need to make or do something
material.translation[2].definitions[0].e: A shortage of building materials compounded escalating costs.
